channel.title: rust on Ryan Faulhaber
channel.description: Recent content in rust on Ryan Faulhaber

item.title: Writing an Emacs module in Rust
item.description: Recently I learned that Emacs supports linking with dynamic modules, so I tried writing one in Rust.

item.title: Writing the module
item.description: For the sake of simplicity, we’ll write a dead simple module, one that’s so simple we could write it in Emacs Lisp: 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 (defun my-message-from-rust () "Returns a message from Rust" "Hello Emacs, I'm from Rust") (defun my-sum (&rest args) "Returns the sum of ARGS" (apply '+ args)) (provide 'my-rust-mod) Our module will provide two functions, my-message-from-rust and my-sum. The former simply returns a string literal, while the latter sums up all the values passed to it.
